Whether he accepted the wise reasoning con- tained in the Mason's words, or believed as a child believes, in the speaker's tone of convic- tion and earnestness, or the tremor of the speak- er's voicewhich sometimes almost broke or those brilliant aged eyes grown old in this con- viction, or the calm firmness and certainty of his vocation, which radiated from his whole be- in
